recipe.name: Huevos Rancheros Tortilla Bowls
recipe.description: Something different for breakfast this weekend! This recipe makes just enough for 3 - I have tried to stretch it to 4 but it was not quite enough (I thought). Or it is for 2 very hungry people!
recipeIngredient: 1  small onion ((red, brown, white, yellow), halved and sliced)
1 cup red capsicum ((bell peppers), roughly diced)
1/4 cup coriander/cilantro ((leaves and stems roughly chopped) (loosely packed))

itemListElement.text: Heat a fry pan over high heat. Use a fry pan with a lid or use the lid of a larger pot (it doesn't matter if it doesn't fit snugly).
itemListElement.name: Heat a fry pan over high heat. Use a fry pan with a lid or use the lid of a larger pot (it doesn't matter if it doesn't fit snugly).

itemListElement.text: Place tortilla in fry pan and cook for 30 seconds until charred. Flip and cook the other side for 30 seconds.
itemListElement.name: Place tortilla in fry pan and cook for 30 seconds until charred. Flip and cook the other side for 30 seconds.

itemListElement.text: Remove from fry pan and place into a bowl or casserole dish to form a bowl shape. As the tortilla cools, it will hold its shape in a bowl form.
itemListElement.name: Remove from fry pan and place into a bowl or casserole dish to form a bowl shape. As the tortilla cools, it will hold its shape in a bowl form.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in fry pan over high heat.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in fry pan over high heat.

itemListElement.text: Add garlic and onion and sauté for 2 minutes until starting to become translucent.
itemListElement.name: Add garlic and onion and sauté for 2 minutes until starting to become translucent.

itemListElement.text: Add capsicum (bell pepper) and cook for 2 minutes until starting to char.
itemListElement.name: Add capsicum (bell pepper) and cook for 2 minutes until starting to char.

itemListElement.text: Add remaining Tomato Filling ingredients, reserving some coriander leave for garnish. Bring to simmer and cook for 1 minute to thicken, then turn heat down to medium.
itemListElement.name: Add remaining Tomato Filling ingredients, reserving some coriander leave for garnish. Bring to simmer and cook for 1 minute to thicken, then turn heat down to medium.

itemListElement.text: Use a spoon to make 3 indents in the Tomato Filling.
itemListElement.name: Use a spoon to make 3 indents in the Tomato Filling.

itemListElement.text: Cover with lid and cook for 3 minutes or to your liking. Check it at 2 minutes, then take a quick peek every 30 seconds thereafter. It can go from under to overcooked in a flash! Note that the eggs will continue to cook slightly after taking it off the heat.
itemListElement.name: Cover with lid and cook for 3 minutes or to your liking. Check it at 2 minutes, then take a quick peek every 30 seconds thereafter. It can go from under to overcooked in a flash! Note that the eggs will continue to cook slightly after taking it off the heat.

itemListElement.text: Divide Tomato Filling between each Tortilla Bowl, topped with an egg.
itemListElement.name: Divide Tomato Filling between each Tortilla Bowl, topped with an egg.

itemListElement.text: Top with remaining coriander leaves and garnish of choice. Serve immediately.
itemListElement.name: Top with remaining coriander leaves and garnish of choice. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Hello.  Love all your recipes.  Been making this dish several times now but I keep forgetting to leave a comment.  Thanks for sharing your love for cooking.
I am in a breakfast rut so this would be a perfect change for me.  I love the char on the tortillas, great added flavor. This is my kind of breakfast and a recipe I need to try soon.

I can definitely see your twist to this dish! It looks delicious! I think this is a very original way to pan fry the tortillas, instead of serving them baked. I now feel like cooking some Mexican food this weekend!
